required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BeFAST or BeSTRONG: Brain Change After Fun Athletic Sports-skill Training or Brain Change After Strength TRaining Focusing ON Gait
clinical_study.official_title: Linking Neuroplasticity With the Outcomes of Walking-based Interventions: A Feasibility Trial Comparing a Motor Learning Versus a Strength-based Program in Children With Cerebral Palsy

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare a motor learning (ML)-based gait-related training intervention to a functional lower limb strength training intervention, with a concurrent evaluation of functional, neural and participation outcomes for children and youth with Cerebral Palsy (CP).
This study is a two-group, parallel arm RCT in which twenty-two children with CP in GMFCS Levels I-II will be randomly allocated to a 6-week, 16 session program of: (i) ML based gait training or (ii) lower limb strength training. Outcome assessments occur pre/post/4-months post-intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in advanced motor skills on the Challenge Module
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7 days post/4-months post training intervention
primary_outcome.description: The Challenge Module is a new published measure of advanced motor skills.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in functional activity in lower-limb related cortical areas, assessed using functional MRI (fMRI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7 days post training intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in resting state activity, assessed using resting state fMRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7 days post training intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in microstructure of brain, assessed using diffusion tensor imaging (DTI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7 days post training intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Physical Activity self-efficacy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post training intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Participant-report measure of Task efficacy and Barrier efficacy for physical activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in walking activity, assessed using an Actigraph accelerometer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post training intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in gait kinematics as measured using an electronic walkway
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post training intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Time/distance parameters of footsteps via GAITRite system.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in physical activity participation, as measured using the Participation and Environment Measure for Children/Youth (PEM-CY)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post training intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Parent-report measure of participation in the home, school and community, as well as environmental factors within each setting.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in walk speed on the Six-minute walk test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post training intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Standardized 6 minute walk test (with shoes, orthoses as required) to determine distance covered (capability measure). Well-validated in pediatric CP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in targeted goal abilities and satisfaction with performance as measured by the Canadian Occupational Performance Measure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post training intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Three to five individualized walking-based activity/participation set at baseline with assessor and child/parent, and re-evaluated by child/parent at post-intervention assessments

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in targeted goal abilities as measured by Goal Attainment Scaling (GAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post training intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Three to five individualized walking-based activity/participation set at baseline with assessor and child/parent, and re-evaluated by child/parent at post-intervention assessments

other_outcome.measure: Motor learning as evaluated using retention and transfer tests
other_outcome.time_frame: Week 2, 4, 6
other_outcome.description: Individualized skills will be identified to practice at every session (retention) and only at sessions 5/10/15 (transfer) to evaluate motor learning

other_outcome.measure: Motor learning content of interventions, as assessed using the Motor Learning Strategy Rating Instrument (MLSRI)
other_outcome.time_frame: Week 2, 4, 6
other_outcome.description: The MLSRI is used to assess the extent to which motor learning strategies are used within an intervention session

other_outcome.measure: Intervention program enjoyment, assessed using a modified version of the Physical Activity Enjoyment Scale (PACES)
other_outcome.time_frame: 7 days post training intervention
other_outcome.description: Participants' enjoyment of the intervention program will be assessed following the intervention

other_outcome.time_frame: 16 times over 6 weeks (following each intervention session)
other_outcome.description: Participants' enjoyment of each session will be assessed using a study-specific questionnaire

other_outcome.measure: Rating of exertion, assessed using Pictorial Children's Effort Rating Table (PCERT)
other_outcome.time_frame: Completed at 22 minutes (mid-point) and at 43-minutes (2-minutes before end) of each intervention session
other_outcome.description: Children will be asked to complete PCERT at mid-point of each session, and 2 minutes before session completion

other_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 4 time points per session: 1 min before start of session, at 22 minutes (mid-point), at 43-minutes (2-min before end), and at 45-minutes (end) of each session
other_outcome.description: Heart rate will be monitored by treating staff member via radial pulse.

other_outcome.time_frame: Completed 2 minutes before and 2 minutes after each intervention session
other_outcome.description: Use of FACES pain scale and body diagrams to show areas of pain (musculoskeletal and other)

other_outcome.time_frame: 7 days post training intervention
other_outcome.description: Parent's satisfaction and perceived benefit of intervention will be assessed using a study-specific questionnaire

other_outcome.time_frame: 7 days post training intervention
other_outcome.description: Staff satisfaction and perceived benefit of intervention for each child in the study will be assessed using a study-specific questionnaire

other_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post intervention
other_outcome.description: A 30 second lateral step-up test will be used bilaterally to assess functional lower limb strength

other_outcome.measure: Ankle range of motion and dorsiflexion force
other_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post intervention
other_outcome.description: Passive and active ROM will be assessed using a goniometer

other_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post intervention
other_outcome.description: Dorsiflexion force will be assessed using surface electromyography (EMG)

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in lower-limb proprioception
other_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post intervention
other_outcome.description: Lower limb joint-sense position will be assessed using a semi-goniometer (protocol modified from Wingert et al, 2009)

other_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post intervention
other_outcome.description: Participants will be timed while walking a 10-meter distance, and then timed while imagining walking the same distance.

other_outcome.time_frame: 7 days pre/7days post/4-months post intervention
other_outcome.description: Participant's motor imagery ability will be assessed using the 12-item MIQ-C

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Recruitment rate: # eligible participants as compared to # screened and # enrolled

other_outcome.measure: Feasibility process indicators: perceived intervention benefit
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Perceived intervention benefit calculated as combined child/parent rating

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Number of children enrolled as compared to number of children who complete the study

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Number of sessions completed

other_outcome.measure: Feasibility resource indicators: data collection time
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Projected vs actual data collection time

other_outcome.measure: Feasibility resource indicators: data collection completion
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Percent missing data

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Within session effort scores

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Video sessions every 2 weeks to assess session content: (i) STRONG group: 1RM lower limb strength progression; (ii) FAST group: Session content via Motor Learning Strategy Rating Instrument (MLSRI)

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Completion of diaries for motor imagery/strength home practice

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Log books for PA-participation tracking/management in active intervention and 4 month follow-up

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: PTA/RKin session summary form data

other_outcome.measure: Feasibility management indicators: Acceptability of intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Aggregate score of: Parent/staff satisfaction scale, child Physical Activity Enjoyment Scale (PACES), child intervention satisfaction score

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Treatment response

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6-months
other_outcome.description: Number of adverse events

arm_group.description: Motor learning-based program involving athletic lower extremity training of gait-related skills.
Lower limb strength training program involving progressive muscle resistance exercises.

intervention.description: The motor learning (ML)-based gait-related training program is designed to improve advanced gross motor skills and athleticism. It will involve 45-min sessions twice to three times weekly over 6 weeks for a total of 16 active sessions. A maximum of 7 weeks will be permitted. Each session will consist of 35-min of active training along with a 10-min active warm-up/cool-down that incorporates ML. Children will be given a 3- to 5-min mental motor imagery script to practice on days when they do not have active training sessions. The total number of sessions (combined training/home imagery) will be five per week.

The functional strength training program is designed to improve gait-related skills. It will involve 45-min sessions twice to three times weekly over 6 weeks for a total of 16 active sessions. A maximum of 7 weeks will be permitted. Each session will consist of 35-min of active training along with a 10-min active warm-up/cool-down. Children will be given a 3- to 5-min home program of strength exercises to practice on days when they do not have active training sessions. The total number of sessions (combined training/home program) will be five per week.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 7-17 years old
- diagnosis of hemiplegic or diplegic Cerebral Palsy
- GMFCS Level I-II
- able to follow testing and motor imagery instructions
- able to actively participate in a minimum of 45 minutes (min) of physical activity
- show evidence of independent dorsiflexion of both ankles
- able to commit to attendance of sessions two to three times weekly for six weeks.
Exclusion Criteria:
- orthopaedic surgery within the last 9 months (muscle) or 12 months (bone)
- Botulinum toxin-A (BTX-A) injections to lower limb in the last 4 months
- inability to put BTX-A on hold during trial
- severe spasticity (may be a contraindication for neuroimaging procedures)
- seizure disorder (if not fully controlled by medication for 12 months)
- not prepared or unable to discontinue any formal lower limb therapy intervention or physical activity program during the trial
- involved in another intervention study
- standard MRI contraindications (e.g., magnetic implants, inability to lay still, claustrophobia etc.)
